Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.annotations.base

Interface Ratio

All Known Implementing Classes:
HpoFrequency
public interface Ratio
Entity to represent the fact that n out of m subjects meet a condition. For instance, 9 out of 10 kids love lasagna.

  • Method Details

    • of

      static Ratio of(int numerator, int denominator)
      Parameters:
      numerator - non-negative numerator
      denominator - positive denominator
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the numerator or denominator do not meet the above requirements, or if the numerator is greater than denominator

    • numerator

      int numerator()
      Returns:
      number of subjects meeting a condition.

    • denominator

      int denominator()
      Returns:
      the total number of evaluated subjects.

    • frequency

      default float frequency()
      Returns:
      frequency of the subjects meeting a condition calculated as numerator() over denominator().

    • isZero

      default boolean isZero()
      Returns:
      true if numerator() is equal to 0.

    • isPositive

      default boolean isPositive()
      Returns:
      true if numerator() is greater than 0.

    • sum

      static Ratio sum(Ratio left, Ratio right)
      Sum the two Ratios. (i.e. 1/2 + 1/4 = 3/6).

      Note: this is not summation of two fractions, but summation of two n over m counts coming from two clinical studies. In other words, if n1 of m1 members of population a and n2 of m2 of population b like lasagna, then n1 + n2 of m1 + m2 people like lasagna in total.

      Returns:
      Ratio representing the sum of left and right.

    • compareByFrequency

      static int compareByFrequency(Ratio left, Ratio right)
      Compare two Ratios by their frequency(). The Ratio with greater frequency is greater.
